Paragraph: Only 5 of the 160 F2 pituitaries exhibited the hemorrhagic phenotype ; 36 of the 160 F2 pituitaries were in the F344 range of mass , but 31 of these were not hemorrhagic , indicating that the hemorrhagic phenotype is not merely a consequence of extensive growth .

| --- |
| hemorrhagic phenotype |

Explanation:

The term "hemorrhagic phenotype" is the only disease-related term in the paragraph. It is mentioned twice and refers to a condition where there is bleeding in the pituitary gland.

Explanation:

The only term that clearly refers to a "Disease" is "hemorrhagic phenotype". The term "F344 range of mass" is not a disease, but rather a comparison to the weight range of a specific strain of rats. The term "extensive growth" is not a disease either, but rather a description of a characteristic of some of the pituitaries.
